description:
Albania, Tirana, January 11th.
Prime Minister and the Minister of Health and Social Protection announced: 
Vaccination against COVID19 starts in Albania, the first doses are provided by Pfizer.
All health workers, ie doctors, nurses who provide services in the Covid hospitals will be the first to be vaccinated. The vaccination will be carried at the national stadium 'Air Albania'.
The Albanian government has provided 500 thousand doses of vaccine from Pfizer.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_vac_purchase: Preorder with the option of expanding the order
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Albania on March 16, 2020 enforced a curfew from 18:00 to 06:00. Movement of pedestrians is prohibited all over the country. Going outside to purchase basic supplies or medicines is allowed. Walking and sitting in parks and other open areas is banned after 18:00hrs. Fines will be imposed upon violation of these restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: 16-hour curfew. Individuals are only allowed to leave their homes from 05:00 to 13:00. All movement is prohibited outside of those windows, including both vehicular traffic and pedestrian movement. Exceptions are made for healthcare workers and for the transport of food items, supplies and medicine. Grocery stores and banks are only permitted to open from 05:00 to 13:00.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On Monday, March 30, the Albanian government imposed an electronic "exit permit" that enables individuals to apply online for permission to leave their residence for various reasons such as for shopping at grocery stores, the pharmacy, or other urgent reasons. The exit approval can also be obtained via SMS to 55155; in the absence of the permit, individuals will be subject to fines. A 16-hour curfew remains in place nationwide, during which individuals are only permitted to shop for essential goods and go to work from 05:00 to 13:00 (local time), after which security forces will enforce the curfew. Emergencies are exempt from these measures.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Modified (from original 16 hour curfew on 23/3/2020). Individuals are now only allowed to leave their homes on weekdays from 05.00 to 17.30 to visit grocery stores, pharmacies and banks. All movement is prohibited outside of those windows, including both vehicular traffic and pedestrian movement. Only one person per household is allowed to go out to buy food or medicine at a time, for a maximum of 90 minutes. The elderly and retirees are no longer permitted to go out. *Exceptions are made for healthcare workers and for the transport of food items, supplies and medicine*. On weekends, curfew is extended from Friday 17.30 until Monday 05.00.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Yes the curfew times differ depending on the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Albania on April 25 declared that seniors can move freely from 6:00 am to 8:30 am only the in low risk towns of Diber and Gjirokaster along with the municipalities of Pogradec, Prrenjas, Librazhd, Saranda, Delvine, Himara, Konispol, Finiq, and Divjak. The policy starts on April 27th.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week

description: Albania is relaxing lockdown restrictions in low risk towns of Diber and Gjirokaster along with the municipalities of Pogradec, Prrenjas, Librazhd, Saranda, Himara, Konispol, Finiq, and Divjak starting on April 27th. Residents can move on foot and by car from 9:30AM until 5:30PM without authorization. UPDATE: Albania is relaxing lockdown restrictions in low risk areas of Albania.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Albania is removing curfew restrictions in all parts of Albania starting on June 1st. UPDATE: Curfew has extended in red zone cities to 5AM to 9PM from Monday through Friday. Green zone cities have no curfew from Monday through Fridays.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: From Monday 11 May, in Albania the following municipalities are added as green areas: Lushnje, Patos, Roskovec, Korça, Has, Kukes, Lezha, Mirdita, Fushë-Arrez, Malësi e Madhe, Puka, Vau Dejes, Kavaja and Vora. In these areas, intercity traffic is allowed within the green areas by private vehicle (allowing the travel of more than two persons of the same family) until 21:00.

description: The Minister of Infrastructure and Energy announced that travel to northern Italy via sea and air will be restricted. Prime Minister Rama reportedly said that all flights and ferries from northern Italy and all the Italian red zones will be suspended until Friday, April 3. It is advised to postpone non-essential travel due to the risk that travelers may be refused entry or be subject to quarantine upon their arrival or during their stay.

description:
By October 2, 2020, "Republic of Kosovo" and "Republic of Albania" have signed a cooperation agreement in the field of health.
"This agreement will further deepen not only the cooperation but also the mutual exchange of experts and health personnel in order to support and clinical case management. Cooperation in the field of providing good medical practice and evidence for the treatment of patients with Covid19. Provision of health and public health services by doctors of both countries for border areas. Establishment of a common platform for information sharing in the context of epidemic surveillance. "Also, reciprocal actions in the framework of the epidemiological investigation, exchange of information for the citizens in both countries, of the cross-border areas, and mutual measures which will continue to be taken following the response to Covid19",
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Albania enforced a two day travel ban in the capital city of Tirana and between other cities in Albania. All private vehicles and public transportation was banned from Friday March 13th through Sunday midnight March 15th.

description: Albanian government has decided from 20 September 2020 to "Prohibits the opening of nightclubs, discos, lounge bars and any kind of service of this nature indoors or outdoors, except restaurants." Those who breaks the law will be fined with 3.000.000 lek (29000 USD) and "suspension of activity for a period of one year." Moreover, there will be the stop of the "music after 20.00 (8.00 pm) in all service facilities of any kind". Those who breaks the law will be fined with 1.000.000 lek (9700 USD) and "suspension of activity for a period of six months."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the business is considered essential or non-essential
institution_status: This type of business ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with no conditions attached
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
